ovdesc.p: This ‘H’ type table contains the definition of all UNIFI (ISO 20022) XML messages used by SEPA. It does so by linking up automatically any tag or group of tags defined in the previous table.

desc.p: This Fields holds the Sequences of the UNIFI XML message:
This Field contains the Name of the UNIFI standard message (e.g. pacs.008.001.01 for BB original CT).
This field contains the Description of the Message
Mandatory and Individual Multi Value field
This field holds the Key to the SEPA.NATURE concerned:
Value should exist in SEPA.NATURE Application
This Field specifies the Purpose of the message:
Value must be 3 AND User can input only values 'CXL' or 'ORI' or 'REF' or 'REJ' or 'RET' or 'REV'
This Field contains the information about the Sender and receiver concerned entities:
Value must be 2 AND User can input only values 'BB' or 'CB' or 'BC'
This field is contains the XML message line indicator and it is a NOINPUT field
NOINPUT field and Multi Value Set
This field specifies the Occurrence of the tag or sequence:
n.M : Occurs at least M times
N.0 : Up to N occurrences or none.
N.M : Occurs between M and N times.
Associated Multi Value Set of field SEQ.FORMAT
This field contains the Tag unique identification in the message.
The unique identification of a Tag that has only one owner is its UNIFI.XML.TAG key.

If the Tag has many potential owners, its unique identification is automatically calculated by concatenating its UNIFI.XML.TAG key to the one of its actual owner with a ‘*‘ as separator. If that owner itself is related to more then one owner, the name of its own actual owner is also added to the unique identification and that goes on until the system reaches a final owner related to only one owner or none. (e.g.: BIC*FinInstnId*InstgAgt*GrpHdr standing for the BIC Code of the Financial Institution of the Instructed Agent present in the Group Header sequence).
NOINPUT field and Associated Multi Value Set of field SEQ.FORMAT
This unique identification will be associated to a mapping inward and outward through the following SEPA.FIELDS and SEPA.LAYOUT table.
This Field contains the Full path name of the tag.
